text: Agnidra scabiosa is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Arthur Gardiner Butler in 1877. It is found in south-eastern Russia, Korea, Japan and China.Agnidra at Markku Savela's Lepidoptera and Some Other Life Forms The wingspan is 14-17.5 mm for males and 17.5–20 mm for females. Adults are similar to Agnidra fuscilinea, but have a distinctive colour pattern of the wings.Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History) (Entomology) Suppl. 12 The larvae feed on Quercus and Castanea species. ==Subspecies== *Agnidra scabiosa scabiosa (Japan, south-eastern Russia) *Agnidra scabiosa fixseni (Bryk, 1949) (Korea, China: Machuria, Chekian, Hunan, Hupeh, Kiangsu) ==References== Category:Moths described in 1877 Category:Drepaninae Category:Moths of Asia
title: Agnidra scabiosa
